trans-unit.source: Accessing HomeGroup content
trans-unit.target: Accessing HomeGroup content

trans-unit.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132)

trans-unit.source: Important APIs
trans-unit.target: Important APIs

trans-unit.source: Windows.Storage.KnownFolders class
trans-unit.target: Windows.Storage.KnownFolders class

trans-unit.source: Access content stored in the user's HomeGroup folder, including pictures, music, and videos.
trans-unit.target: Access content stored in the user's HomeGroup folder, including pictures, music, and videos.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps
trans-unit.target: Understand async programming for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps

trans-unit.source: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).
trans-unit.target: You can learn how to write asynchronous apps in C\# or Visual Basic, see [Call asynchronous APIs in C\# or Visual Basic](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187337).

trans-unit.source: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to write asynchronous apps in C++, see [Asynchronous programming in C++](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187334).

trans-unit.source: App capabilty declarations
trans-unit.target: App capabilty declarations

trans-unit.source: To access HomeGroup content, the user's machine must have a HomeGroup set up and your app must have at least one of the following capabilities: **picturesLibrary**, **musicLibrary**, or **videosLibrary**.
trans-unit.target: To access HomeGroup content, the user's machine must have a HomeGroup set up and your app must have at least one of the following capabilities: **picturesLibrary**, **musicLibrary**, or **videosLibrary**.

trans-unit.source: When your app accesses the HomeGroup folder, it will see only the libraries that correspond to the capabilities declared in your app's manifest.
trans-unit.target: When your app accesses the HomeGroup folder, it will see only the libraries that correspond to the capabilities declared in your app's manifest.

trans-unit.source: To learn more, see [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn more, see [File access permissions](file-access-permissions.md).

trans-unit.source: **Note** Content in the Documents library of a HomeGroup isn't visible to your app regardless of the capabilities declared in your app's manifest and regardless of the user's sharing settings.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Content in the Documents library of a HomeGroup isn't visible to your app regardless of the capabilities declared in your app's manifest and regardless of the user's sharing settings.

trans-unit.source: Understand how to use file pickers
trans-unit.target: Understand how to use file pickers

trans-unit.source: You typically use the file picker to access files and folders in the HomeGroup.
trans-unit.target: You typically use the file picker to access files and folders in the HomeGroup.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to use the file picker, see [Open files and folders with a picker](quickstart-using-file-and-folder-pickers.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn how to use the file picker, see [Open files and folders with a picker](quickstart-using-file-and-folder-pickers.md).

trans-unit.source: Understand file and folder queries
trans-unit.target: Understand file and folder queries

trans-unit.source: You can use queries to enumerate files and folders in the HomeGroup.
trans-unit.target: You can use queries to enumerate files and folders in the HomeGroup.

trans-unit.source: To learn about file and folder queries, see [Enumerating and querying files and folders](quickstart-listing-files-and-folders.md).
trans-unit.target: To learn about file and folder queries, see [Enumerating and querying files and folders](quickstart-listing-files-and-folders.md).

trans-unit.source: Open the file picker at the HomeGroup
trans-unit.target: Open the file picker at the HomeGroup

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to open an instance of the file picker that lets the user pick files and folders from the HomeGroup:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to open an instance of the file picker that lets the user pick files and folders from the HomeGroup:

trans-unit.source: Create and customize the file picker
trans-unit.target: Create and customize the file picker

trans-unit.source: Use [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to create the file picker, and then set the picker's [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854) to [**PickerLocationId.HomeGroup**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207890).
trans-unit.target: Use [**FileOpenPicker**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207847) to create the file picker, and then set the picker's [**SuggestedStartLocation**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207854) to [**PickerLocationId.HomeGroup**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207890).

trans-unit.source: Or, set other properties that are relevant to your users and your app.
trans-unit.target: Or, set other properties that are relevant to your users and your app.

trans-unit.source: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see [Guidelines and checklist for file pickers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465182)
trans-unit.target: For guidelines to help you decide how to customize the file picker, see [Guidelines and checklist for file pickers](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465182)

trans-unit.source: This example creates a file picker that opens at the HomeGroup, includes files of any type, and displays the files as thumbnail images:
trans-unit.target: This example creates a file picker that opens at the HomeGroup, includes files of any type, and displays the files as thumbnail images:

trans-unit.source: Show the file picker and process the picked file.
trans-unit.target: Show the file picker and process the picked file.

trans-unit.source: After you create and customize the file picker, let the user pick one file by calling [**FileOpenPicker.PickSingleFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj635275), or multiple files by calling [**FileOpenPicker.PickMultipleFilesAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207851).
trans-unit.target: After you create and customize the file picker, let the user pick one file by calling [**FileOpenPicker.PickSingleFileAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/jj635275), or multiple files by calling [**FileOpenPicker.PickMultipleFilesAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207851).

trans-unit.source: This example displays the file picker to let the user pick one file:
trans-unit.target: This example displays the file picker to let the user pick one file:

trans-unit.source: Search the HomeGroup for files
trans-unit.target: Search the HomeGroup for files

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to find HomeGroup items that match a query term provided by the user.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to find HomeGroup items that match a query term provided by the user.

trans-unit.source: Get the query term from the user.
trans-unit.target: Get the query term from the user.

trans-unit.source: Here we get a query term that the user has entered into a [**TextBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209683) control called `searchQueryTextBox`:
trans-unit.target: Here we get a query term that the user has entered into a [**TextBox**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br209683) control called `searchQueryTextBox`:

trans-unit.source: Set the query options and search filter.
trans-unit.target: Set the query options and search filter.

trans-unit.source: Query options determine how the search results are sorted, while the search filter determines which items are included in the search results.
trans-unit.target: Query options determine how the search results are sorted, while the search filter determines which items are included in the search results.

trans-unit.source: This example sets query options that sort the search results by relevance and then the date modified.
trans-unit.target: This example sets query options that sort the search results by relevance and then the date modified.

trans-unit.source: The search filter is the query term that the user entered in the previous step:
trans-unit.target: The search filter is the query term that the user entered in the previous step:

trans-unit.source: Run the query and process the results.
trans-unit.target: Run the query and process the results.

trans-unit.source: The following example runs the search query in the HomeGroup and saves the names of any matching files as a list of strings.
trans-unit.target: The following example runs the search query in the HomeGroup and saves the names of any matching files as a list of strings.

trans-unit.source: Search the HomeGroup for a particular user's shared files
trans-unit.target: Search the HomeGroup for a particular user's shared files

trans-unit.source: This section shows you how to find HomeGroup files that are shared by a particular user.
trans-unit.target: This section shows you how to find HomeGroup files that are shared by a particular user.

trans-unit.source: Get a collection of HomeGroup users.
trans-unit.target: Get a collection of HomeGroup users.

trans-unit.source: Each of the first-level folders in the HomeGroup represents an individual HomeGroup user.
trans-unit.target: Each of the first-level folders in the HomeGroup represents an individual HomeGroup user.

trans-unit.source: So, to get the collection of HomeGroup users, call [**GetFoldersAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227279) retrieve the top-level HomeGroup folders.
trans-unit.target: So, to get the collection of HomeGroup users, call [**GetFoldersAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br227279) retrieve the top-level HomeGroup folders.

trans-unit.source: Find the target user's folder, and then create a file query scoped to that user's folder.
trans-unit.target: Find the target user's folder, and then create a file query scoped to that user's folder.

trans-unit.source: The following example iterates through the retrieved folders to find the target user's folder.
trans-unit.target: The following example iterates through the retrieved folders to find the target user's folder.

trans-unit.source: Then, it sets query options to find all files in the folder, sorted first by relevance and then by the date modified.
trans-unit.target: Then, it sets query options to find all files in the folder, sorted first by relevance and then by the date modified.

trans-unit.source: The example builds a string that reports the number of files found, along with the names of the files.
trans-unit.target: The example builds a string that reports the number of files found, along with the names of the files.

trans-unit.source: Stream video from the HomeGroup
trans-unit.target: Stream video from the HomeGroup

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to stream video content from the HomeGroup:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to stream video content from the HomeGroup:

trans-unit.source: Include a MediaElement in your app.
trans-unit.target: Include a MediaElement in your app.

trans-unit.source: A [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) lets you play back audio and video content in your app.
trans-unit.target: A [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926) lets you play back audio and video content in your app.

trans-unit.source: For more information on audio and video playback, see [Create custom transport controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187271) and [Audio, video, and camera](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt203788).
trans-unit.target: For more information on audio and video playback, see [Create custom transport controls](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187271) and [Audio, video, and camera](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt203788).

trans-unit.source: Open a file picker at the HomeGroup and apply a filter that includes video files in the formats that your app supports.
trans-unit.target: Open a file picker at the HomeGroup and apply a filter that includes video files in the formats that your app supports.

trans-unit.source: This example includes .mp4 and .wmv files in the file open picker.
trans-unit.target: This example includes .mp4 and .wmv files in the file open picker.

trans-unit.source: **Open the the user's file selection for read access, and set the file stream as the source for the** [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926), and then play the file.
trans-unit.target: **Open the the user's file selection for read access, and set the file stream as the source for the** [**MediaElement**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br242926), and then play the file.
